etymons.meaning: to hang up, suspend; to lift up, raise

Preterit.turoyo: 3) bale u=bal-anotle m-i=ḥolo 442; 1/34; 2) ġắlabehawisawwəssi w hawimaraqli d-i=kačk-ati d-ḥəzyole w d-kət-walayəq w ṣpahiyehawxa, w d-bəṯṯərtəlyo me-qumʕayne 444; 105/112;

Infectum.turoyo: 1) ṭray, be d-ʔu=adm-ano, d-bīzbaynoṯayna d-mətle b-i=səbb-aṯe 442; 53/105;
2) minax ko-mətle m-aloholə=ko-mətle 444; 78/232; the same example in 29/40 - Idiom???

Imperativ.turoyo: 1) tli l-droʕux d-ḥozenadíqo-yo 442; prs 197/21; 3) hat fṣiḥat w raqiḏatlăšan i=ḥmərto, tli me-qumi 443; prs 155/2; 4) tli-lax ak=kallat, bemiǧāle-hat 443; prs 158/18, 24; 5) kurxiaf=farošeaʕli, tli-li 444; prs 249/8; huleqirat, ‘Tlawuiḏo, kaṯino’
translations: ‘He gave them courage, “Keep fighting (lit. ‘hold up the hand’), I have come!’” 269 NE Story of David ln. 13
